javax.jaxtx.model.btp.opt
Interface Superior

All Known Subinterfaces:
Transaction
public interface Superior

This is the interface that all superiors provide. It enables new atoms or cohesions to be created and participants to be enrolled/resigned from the specific "transaction".

Method Summary
 java.lang.String begin(java.lang.String parent, Qualifier[] qualifiers)
          Start a new transaction (atom or cohesion).
 void cancelled(java.lang.String id, java.lang.String participantId, Qualifier[] qualifiers)
          A participant may unilaterally decide to cancel at any time, i.e., even if it has not been prepared.
 void confirmed(java.lang.String id, java.lang.String participantId, Qualifier[] qualifiers)
          A participant may unilaterally decide to confirm after it has prepared.
 void enrol(java.lang.String id, java.lang.String participantId, Inferior participant, Qualifier[] qualifiers)
          The specified inferior (identity and inferior handle) is enlisted with the superior.
 void prepared(java.lang.String id, java.lang.String participantId, Qualifier[] qualifiers)
          A participant may unilaterally decide that it can prepare and it must inform the coordinator.
 void resign(java.lang.String id, java.lang.String participantId, Qualifier[] qualifiers)
          The specified inferior resigns from the inferior.
 StatusItem[] statuses(java.lang.String id, java.lang.String[] participants)
           
 

Method Detail

begin

public java.lang.String begin(java.lang.String parent,
                              Qualifier[] qualifiers)
                       throws SystemException,
                              InvalidSuperiorException,
                              WrongStateException
Start a new transaction (atom or cohesion). If the parent parameter is set then the newly created transaction is automatically enrolled with the specified transaction as a participant.
Parameters:
String - parent The identity of any parent transaction. If present, the newly created transaction will be nested or enrolled with the parent depending upon the nature of any qualifiers.
Qualifier[] - qualifiers Any additional qualifiers that may affect the begin.
Returns:
the identity of the newly created transaction.
Throws:
InvalidSuperiorException - Thrown if the superior identity is invalid.
SystemException - Thrown in the event of a general fault.
WrongStateException - Thrown if the superior is in an invalid state.

enrol

public void enrol(java.lang.String id,
                  java.lang.String participantId,
                  Inferior participant,
                  Qualifier[] qualifiers)
           throws SystemException,
                  InvalidSuperiorException,
                  WrongStateException,
                  DuplicateInferiorException
The specified inferior (identity and inferior handle) is enlisted with the superior.
Parameters:
String - id The identity of the superior to enrol with.
String - participantId The identity of the inferior to be enrolled. this may be null and in which case a new identity will be created.
Inferior - participant The inferior to be enrolled.
Qualifier[] - qualifiers Any additional qualifiers that may affect the enrol.
Throws:
InvalidSuperiorException - Thrown if the superior identity is invalid.
WrongStateException - Thrown if the superior is in an invalid state.
DuplicateInferiorException - Thrown if an inferior with the specified id has already been enrolled.
SystemException - Thrown in the event of a general fault.

resign

public void resign(java.lang.String id,
                   java.lang.String participantId,
                   Qualifier[] qualifiers)
            throws SystemException,
                   InvalidSuperiorException,
                   InvalidInferiorException,
                   WrongStateException
The specified inferior resigns from the inferior.
Parameters:
String - id The identity of the superior to resign from.
String - participantId The identity of the inferior to resign.
Qualifier[] - qualifiers Any additional qualifiers that may affect the resign.
Throws:
InvalidSuperiorException - Thrown if the superior identity is invalid.
InvalidInferiorException - Thrown if the inferior is unknown to this superior (e.g., it has not been enrolled.)
WrongStateException - Thrown if the superior is in an invalid state.
SystemException - Thrown in the event of a general fault.

statuses

public StatusItem[] statuses(java.lang.String id,
                             java.lang.String[] participants)
                      throws SystemException,
                             InvalidSuperiorException
Parameters:
String - id The identity of the superior to enquire of.
String - participants The list of inferiors whose status we require.
Returns:
the status for the specified inferiors.
Throws:
InvalidSuperiorException - Thrown if the superior identity is invalid.
SystemException - Thrown in the event of a general fault.
See Also:
javax.jaxtx.models.btp.StatusItem

prepared

public void prepared(java.lang.String id,
                     java.lang.String participantId,
                     Qualifier[] qualifiers)
              throws InvalidSuperiorException,
                     InvalidInferiorException,
                     WrongStateException,
                     SystemException
A participant may unilaterally decide that it can prepare and it must inform the coordinator.
Parameters:
String - id The identity of the superior to inform.
String - participantId The participant identifier.
Qualifier[] - qualifiers Any additional qualifiers that may affect the prepare call.
Throws:
InvalidSuperiorException - Thrown if the superior identity is invalid.
InvalidInferiorException - Thrown if the inferior is unknown to this superior (e.g., it has not been enrolled.)
WrongStateException - Thrown if the superior is in an invalid state.
SystemException - Thrown in the event of a general fault.
